intro: Cacalia biafrae, commonly known as the Biafra cacalia, is a flowering plant native to Nigeria. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a circular pattern. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
